speaker: Albert
text: Sorry.  I'm a nervous flyer.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, I see.  Oh, you're white as a sheet.

speaker: Albert
text: No, actually, I'm always this pale.  My ex-wife used to say she could tell when I was embarrassed because I'd turn off-white.

speaker: Lilith
text: I can empathize.  Sometimes after a late night, I covered my under-eye circles with Liquid Paper.  So are you traveling to Seattle for business or pleasure?

speaker: Albert
text: Both, hopefully.  I'm relocating for work.  How about you?

speaker: Lilith
text: I need to ask an old friend for a favor.

speaker: Albert
text: It's a long trip just to ask for a favor.

speaker: Lilith
text: It's a big favor.

speaker: Albert
text: Well I hope your friend complies.

speaker: Lilith
text: It'll take some work, but I'll get what I want.  [_A flight attendant comes up._]

speaker: Attendant
text: Oh, dear, you two look awfully pale.  Can I bring you something?

speaker: Lilith
text: Not unless you have any extra melanin lying around.  [_She leaves as Albert laughs._]

speaker: Albert
text: You should be a comedian.

speaker: Lilith
text: I've thought about it.  [_She goes back to her reading.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin is walking from the kitchen to his chair.  When he hears keys in the door, he sets his beer down and hurries towards the bedroom.  The door opens and Frasier comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?  Dad, Dad!  What?  Are you hiding?

speaker: Martin
text: I heard the key in the door, I thought Lilith might be with you.  What's she coming for anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't really know.  She said she was flying across the country to ask me about something that was important. She's being very mysterious about it.  [_He hangs up his coat as the doorbell rings._]

speaker: Martin
text: Is that her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no.  No, Dad, I'm not seeing her until tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let me know when she's coming, will you, so I can come up with an excuse to clear out.  Because I'm not good at winging it.  [_Frasier opens the door.  It is Lilith._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lilith.  Hi.  Look who's here, Dad.

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Martin.  [_Martin smiles nervously, then glances at his watch._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, time to go... practice my signature.  [_He heads for the bedrooms._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, come on in, Lilith.  So, I didn't think I was going to be seeing you 'til tomorrow.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, I know that was the plan, but I just had to stop by on my way to the hotel.  What I'm here to talk to you about is not something one just drops on another person. [_gesturing for him to sit_] Please.  [_He sits down._]

speaker: Lilith
text: [_sitting beside him_] Frasier, recently a subconscious yearning has tunneled its way to the surface and I now know what it is I need in order to make my life complete.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's wonderful news.  How can I help?

speaker: Lilith
text: You can give me your sperm.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Lilith
text: I want to have another baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you certainly don't need me for that.  Surely... someone in Boston must have sperm.

speaker: Lilith
text: I came to you first so that Frederick could have a full sibling.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, just like that we're going to have another baby together.

speaker: Lilith
text: No, not just like that.  I mapped out our dominant and recessive traits on a genome square, applied Mendel's laws, allowed for anomalies and concluded that you are the best biological choice.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, as enticed as I am by your honeyed words, I'm gonna need some kissin'.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, don't misunderstand, I'm not proposing any change in our relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would we... sleep together?

speaker: Lilith
text: I thought we'd freeze your sperm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that a "yes" or a "no"?

speaker: Lilith
text: Natural fertilization is impractical.  I'd have to fly to Seattle every time I ovulate.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_]  Right, okay.  So, then your plan is for me to visit some local doctor, freeze my essence and then bring it home with you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Correct.  I'll take mine to go.  [_Frasier sits on the arm of Martin's chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  I'm going to have to think about it.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_rising_]  Yes, of course, absolutely.  Think about it, and you can give me your answer tomorrow.  [_She heads for the door, Frasier follows._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Lilith
text: You can come back from around the corner now, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_from around the corner_]  Good night, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Good night.  [_She leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You were eavesdropping?  [_Martin comes into the living room._]

speaker: Martin
text: It was an accident and I only heard the part about her wanting to have another baby with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: She completely threw me.  [_Martin settles into his chair._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't know why you're so surprised.  She's seen what the Crane genes can do and she's coming back to the well.

speaker: Frasier
text: How does one respond to something like that?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I bet if you say "No" she'll go to Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, it's just so self-centered.  I mean, she's got this all figured out for herself without the slightest consideration for my life.

speaker: Martin
text: And Niles'll say "No" for sure.  Which means only one thing. [_He gets a worried look._] She'll come to the source.  Me. The fountainhead.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Can you imagine?  Lilith's and my kid would be brother to you and Niles AND Freddie.

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Martin
text: And if you and Lilith got back together, you'd be his step-father and his brother and Niles would be your son and his own uncle.  It's almost worth doing just so that I can tell the story.  [_Frasier just waves this off as he heads to his room.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier is sitting at a table.  Niles walks in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi, Niles.  Did Daphne and her mom get off okay?

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting down_] Yes.  They picked up Roz and Alice an hour ago.  Although, how they're going to get all the way to Canada without killing each other, I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why did they have to go so far?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that was my idea.  I read that Canadian Fun Country is one of the best amusement parks in southeastern British Columbia.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm just saying Daphne's mom should be careful, you know.  If you're here on a temporary visa, you know sometimes people have a hard time getting back into the country.

speaker: Niles
text: [_deadpan_] That hadn't occurred to me, Frasier.  [_N.B. Niles no doubt recalls the family trip in[[1.21] "Travels With Martin"](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_21/travels_with_martin.html), in which the Cranes strayed over the border before Daphne's green card had come through, and they had to smuggle her back posing as an American._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, seeing as how you're single, I'd invite you to join me for dinner, but I'm meeting with Lilith tonight on a matter of some delicacy.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad told me.  Now listen, don't feel obligated because she's buying you dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Truth be told, Niles, I hadn't ruled it out entirely.  It would be nice to have another child.  And Lilith is a wonderful mother.  It's just that, well, is it right to create a human being with a woman to whom you couldn't stand being married?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm behind you whatever decision you make, the right one or the crazy one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_Niles calls out to the passing Barista._]

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, may I have an espresso?  [_The waiter nods and heads off.  Frasier notices an envelope Niles brought in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What have you got here?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, some snapshots from last summer at the beach.  Daphne finally got them developed.  [_He shows them to Frasier who starts chuckling._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there's Dad eating that hot dog he dropped in the sand. And you, in your linen beach ensemble.

speaker: Niles
text: Very nice, yes.  Well that's strange.  Daphne said I'd particularly like the last picture on the roll but what is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to tell, it's too dark and blurry.

speaker: Niles
text: Looks like the eye of Jupiter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Or a slice of pepperoni

speaker: Niles
text: Is it a flying saucer?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Niles, it's a flying saucer.  Mystery solved, well done.  [_The Barista brings Niles's coffee over and sees the photo._]

speaker: Barista
text: Hey, where'd you get the nipple shot?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord!  [_Frasier and Niles look again in shock, then Niles clutches the photo to his chest._]

speaker: Niles
text: You are to erase that from your mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it Daphne?

speaker: Barista
text: Nice.

speaker: Niles
text: You're not erasing!  Erase!  [_The Barista heads off as Niles points a warning finger at Frasier. Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Daphne is driving, with Roz next to her and Alice and Gertrude in the back._]

speaker: Roz
text: I need to stop again.

speaker: Daphne
text: We just stopped.  I told you not to get that Big Gulp.

speaker: Roz
text: But it was only ten cents more.

speaker: Alice
text: Punch buggy blue!  [_She hits Gertrude on the arm._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Ow!  Dammit!

speaker: Daphne
text: Language!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Why does she keep doing that?

speaker: Roz
text: It's a game.

speaker: Gertrude
text: It hurts.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, mum.

speaker: Roz
text: There's a gas station right there, I really need to stop.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't get over, you'll have to wait.

speaker: Roz
text: But according to this, my bladder is holding "Thirsty-Two" ounces of soda.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's only forty miles.

speaker: Alice
text: Punch buggy red.  [_She hits Gertrude on the arm._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh!  Son of a...!

speaker: Daphne
text: Language!

speaker: Roz
text: Alice, honey.  Stop hitting Mrs. Moon.  She can't take the punch buggy game.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, really?  Punch buggy white!  [_She knuckles Roz on the shoulder._]

speaker: Roz
text: Ow!  It was a Jeep!

speaker: Gertrude
text: I play the Jeeps.  And Ford.  Punch buggy Ford.  [_She whacks Roz on the head._]

speaker: Roz
text: Ow!  [_Roz turns around to get her back._]

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, that's enough.  You stop it or no one's going to Canadian Fun Country.  And this time I mean it!  [_They go for a minute in silence, then Gertrude screams and points, startling screams from everyone else._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: I'm sorry.  I thought you were on the wrong side of the road.  I will never get used to the crazy way you drive over here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, you have to stop doing that.

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, you seem stressed.  Do you want me to drive for a while?

speaker: Daphne
text: Maybe once we get out of Seattle.  [_Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Frasier and Lilith are sitting at a table looking over menus._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, I don't want to rush you, but the suspense is too much to bear.  Have you decided?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm thinking about the linguini.

speaker: Lilith
text: I see.  It's "No," then, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Lilith.  This was a very difficult decision for me and I am touched and flattered that you came to me, but I'm not sure I'd be doing it for the right reason.  You understand, don't you?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, I do.  And I appreciate your taking the time to think about it.  It's that kind of consideration I was hoping to pass on to our second born.  Oh, well.  So, the pasta is good here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the best.  [_She glances at the menu some more, then begins to quietly sing to the tune of the "Ode to Joy" chorus of Beethoven's 9th._]

speaker: Lilith
text: My dad is the gweatest dad because he cooks me Cweam of Wheat...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_glaring at her_]  Lilith, what are you singing?

speaker: Lilith
text: Was I singing?

speaker: Frasier
text: You were singing "My Dad Is the Gweatest Dad."

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, you mean that song Frederick wrote for you when he was four.

speaker: Frasier
text: That video is one of my prized possessions.  Of course I haven't looked at it in some time.

speaker: Lilith
text: I remember the night we surprised you with it.  He crawled up in your lap and said "Why is Daddy cwying?"

speaker: Frasier
text: I see what you're doing, you know.

speaker: Lilith
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You are attempting to manipulate me by invoking powerful emotional memories.

speaker: Lilith
text: I assure you, nothing could be further from the truth.  [_A waiter comes up._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Are you ready to order?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes.  I'll have the basgetti and beatmalls.

speaker: Waiter
text: Mmm.  Very good Miss.

speaker: Lilith
text: That's what our son used to say when he was three.

speaker: Waiter
text: Excellent.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'll have the veal.

speaker: Waiter
text: Bravo, sir.  [_He takes the menus and heads away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, I'm afraid you're idealizing parenthood.  Do you remember colic, teething, changing mountains of diapers?

speaker: Lilith
text: Do you remember that time in the bath when he tried to eat the bubbles?  We told him to stop, but we kept laughing so he thought it was funny and kept doing it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'd forgotten that.  Oh, I wish we had that on video.  [_She grabs his hand._]

speaker: Lilith
text: You can, Frasier.  We can have those days back again. Please, I just need is a couple of teaspoons.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith!

speaker: Lilith
text: Just think about what Frederick has meant in our lives.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think about it every day.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, we're always seeking ways we can leave a legacy. Well, forget my research and your work, this is it!  What better gift can we bestow on the world but another person as wonderful as Frederick?  [_Frasier signals the waiter passing by._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, I've changed my mind.  I've decided that I too will have the basgetti and beatmalls.  [_Lilith looks up at him, grateful.  Fade out._]  _End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa_  [_Fade in.  Niles is sitting at a table, Frasier is getting juice at the counter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_He comes over to join Niles_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, that coffee smells so good.  Lilith won't let me have any caffeine until I've made my little donation.  [_He sits down._]

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, have you heard from Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: No, we keep missing each other.  I'm just glad I have our little... pictorial memento to keep me company.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe you're so taken with that blurry, over-exposed photo of a...

speaker: Niles
text: Shh!!

speaker: Frasier
text: Of what you first mistook to be a flying saucer!

speaker: Niles
text: I just think it's sexy that she even did it.  Just imagine it: she saw that there was one picture left on the roll, and in a spontaneous moment of brazen exhibitionism, she threw open her blouse and didn't even bother to adjust the f-stop.  Yes indeed, I am married to one spicy meatball.  [_He opens his jacket and checks the picture._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord!  Don't tell me you carry it around with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I didn't want the housekeeper to find it and think we were pornographers.  [_Frasier just takes this in stride.  Fade out._]  **SOME MAGAZINES, A SPECIMEN CUP, AND A RECORDING OF "TRISTAN UND ISOLDE"**   [_Fade in.  Frasier and Lilith are checking in._]

speaker: Nurse
text: Just fill out these forms and I can show you to one of our donation suites.  [_Fraser takes a clipboard and he and Lilith sit.  As he fills out the form, the man across from him glances up._]

speaker: Man
text: Will this be your first?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I've been doing this since I was twelve.  [_Lilith kicks him gently._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean baby.  No, no, this is our second.

speaker: Man
text: We've got number four on the way.

speaker: Lilith
text: And we're thrilled for you, but perhaps we could chat some other time when we're not trying to create life.  [_to Frasier_] Sign and date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  [_He finishes up the form and Lilith takes it back to the window._]

speaker: Man
text: This process can be hard on a relationship, but she'll relax and things'll get better.

speaker: Frasier
text: We're already divorced.

speaker: Man
text: Good, 'cause she'll never change.  [_The man's wife slaps him on the shoulder at this.  Lilith comes back._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Up and at 'em.  [_He gets up._]

speaker: Nurse
text: Follow me, sir.  [_She leads him to a room._]

speaker: Nurse
text: Just go in and make yourself comfortable.  You'll find everything you need in the cabinet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  [_He starts in, but Lilith stops him._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, wait Frasier.  It probably doesn't matter, but try to think positive thoughts.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for that.  I was going to think about the plight of the American Indian.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm just saying we should put the welfare of the sample first.  [_He goes into the room and closes the door.  Lilith turns away, then turns back and taps on the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_from inside_]  Yes?

speaker: Lilith
text: And don't fall asleep afterwards, I want to get these puppies on ice ASAP.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodbye now.  [_She starts away, but turns back again, tapping on the door._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Just a hint...

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith!  If there is ONE thing I can do BY MYSELF, this is it!  Now go away.  [_She heads back to the seats._]

speaker: Nurse
text: Right this way.  [_She leads the other couple off as Lilith sits down and dials her cell phone.  A cell phone rings in Frasier's donation suite.  He yanks the door open, furious._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Lilith
text: I just remembered a special method which supposedly increases the likelihood of having a boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Is there something I can do to increase the likelihood that we won't have a meddling control freak?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, but perhaps you can use a method that will give us a baby that can take other people's advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: I would settle for a method where it won't turn out to be a sarcastic prig!

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, just do it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine!

speaker: Lilith
text: Wait, I don't want you to do it when you're mad.  Why don't we just take a minute to sit down and breathe?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's your dime.  [_He comes out and sits down beside her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God.  What if this child inherits all of our flaws instead of our strengths?  We could create a real nightmare.

speaker: Lilith
text: That's not going to happen.  It's going to be exactly the way it was the first time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is that what's going on here?  Are we trying to create a baby or just trying to recreate the past?  I mean, Frederick's almost grown now, it's only natural to feel a sense of loss.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, don't be simplistic.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Lilith, I know what you're going through.  You want to feel needed and loved as you were when you were a new mother. The past can be very seductive.  I mean, I've fallen into it too: I'm trying to relive Freddie's childhood.  You can't use the past to fill what's missing in the present.  It's gone.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, I've done a lot of thinking and this feels right to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: But it's not right for me.  I'm sorry.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm sorry too.  [_They get up and hug._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You all right?

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm fine.  If I can't make anther little Frederick with you, there's always cloning.  [_Frasier's jaw drops._]

speaker: Lilith
text: And you still don't know when I'm joking.

speaker: Frasier
text: I, well, I...  [_He grabs his coat._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, what are you going to do now?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, I'm going to go home and give Frederick a very big hug.  [_She opens the door._]

speaker: Lilith
text: And maybe swab the inside of his cheek.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop that!  [_They head out.  Fade out._]   [_Fade in.  Martin is in his chair, eating a snack.  Niles comes in the front._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you already ate.  I was gonna take you to Bogart's.

speaker: Martin
text: Bogart's? [_putting the dish down_] Oh, don't worry about that, I was just eatin' it because it was here.  I wasn't eatin' it to get full.  Just give me two minutes.  [_He gets up and heads for his room.  As Niles sits on the couch his cell phone rings and he answers._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_voice over_]  Oh, Niles, darling.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne!  [_Cut to - Daphne and the others in her car._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought I'd never reach you.  We were booted from the park and are coming home.  It seems someone put out a cigarette on a stuffed moose.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I didn't know it was stuffed, I was defending myself.

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] I loved those pictures you left for me.  [_Cut to - Niles on the couch._]

speaker: Niles
text: More specifically, the last one.  [_He pulls it out of his pocket._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_v.o._] Something a little different, eh?

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed it is.  I can't even believe you took it.  [_Cut to - Daphne._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't take it, your father did.  [_Cut to - Niles._]

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't think so.  I'm talking about the last picture on the roll, the close-up.  [_Cut to - Daphne._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah.  You're father was trying to get a picture of Eddy, but instead he got a picture of his own chest.  [_Cut to - Niles looking troubled._]

speaker: Niles
text: This is Dad's...?  [_Cut to - Daphne._]

speaker: Daphne
text: That's his nipple.  [_Cut to - Niles looking horrified.  Martin comes in as Niles slowly rises._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I can't wait to get to Bogart's.  I know just what I'm going to get:  the barbecue chicken breast.  They have the juiciest one in town.  Or, or the lamb.  They serve an enormous rack.

speaker: Niles
text: [_flustered_] Great.

speaker: Martin
text: You might want to get an overcoat of Frasier's out of there. It's supposed to be pretty nippy tonight.  [_Niles, troubled, grabs the coat.  Frasier comes in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Dad.  Where are you going?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Niles is here.  We're just going out for a bite.  You want to join us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure.

speaker: Martin
text: So, how's Lilith?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just dropped her off at the airport.  She's disappointed, but she knows that we're doing the right thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, for what it's worth, I think you are too, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, Dad.  I just hope she finds what's missing in her life.  [_Dissolve to - Lilith on the airplane, looking out the window.  Someone approaches._]

speaker: Albert
text: Hey, pasty.  [_She looks up and sees the man who was sitting next to her when she flew in to Seattle._]

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, hello.

speaker: Albert
text: May I?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, certainly.  [_He sits down._]

speaker: Lilith
text: What happened?  I thought you were relocating to Seattle.

speaker: Albert
text: Oh, it wasn't a fit.  I'm going back to Boston.  I don't know, call me neurotic, I just can't work in a lab that's not immaculate.

speaker: Lilith
text: You work in a lab?

speaker: Albert
text: Mm-hmm.  I'm a physicist.

speaker: Lilith
text: Really?  [_She looks at him speculatively._]

speaker: Lilith
text: My name's Lilith.  [_They shake hands._]

speaker: Albert
text: Ah, the demon-goddess.  Are you like the independent fireball that was your predecessor?

speaker: Lilith
text: I make her look like a vacillating cream puff.

speaker: Albert
text: Albert.  [_They shake hands again._]

speaker: Albert
text: What happened with your friend?  Did you get your favor?

speaker: Lilith
text: It's a long story.

speaker: Albert
text: Well, it's, it's a long flight.  [_She smiles at him and settles in to talk.  Fade out._]
